A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: My biggest issues... (spoilers) 1. The character assassination of Luke Skywalker. This guy refused to fight his father — the most vile\, evil\, child-murdering despot in the galaxy\, because he believed he could turn him back to the light side. Yet this same character\, is going to straight-up murder his nephew\, in his sleep\, because he’s been acting a little dark side-y. WTF. 2. Snoke. Not only do we get nothing about Snoke origin\, or what he was up to during the original trilogy\, but he gets taken out like a total imbecile. No epic Force battle with Luke\, or even Rey or Kylo. Nothing 3. Totally ignoring TFA plotlines. Knights of Ren anyone? Rey’s parentage? Rian Johnson wiped his rear with the script of TFA and served us nothing burgers. 4. The slow-motion space chase. Nothing else needs to be said. 5. Leia lives. They set up the perfect death\, which worked out even better with Fisher’s actual death\, but for some asinine reason\, she goes all space Jesus on us. 6. Finn and the new Jar Jar character doing... something\, somewhere\, on a casino planet\, saving weird horse things while leaving slave kids in bondage and hooking up with Benicio Del Total Stranger and then... what? I’m still confused. This movie was a complete waste. Star Wars should pretend this never happened and try again with The Force Awakens plotlines.
